paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2-G572S variant associated with long QT syndrome type 2, detailing its functional effects and the role of KCNE2 in modulating its activity.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The results suggested that KCNE2 could shorten action potential duration which was prolonged by G572S.
The results suggested that KCNE2 could shorten action potential duration which was prolonged by G572S.

The results suggested that KCNE2 could shorten action potential duration which was prolonged by G572S.

functional_data.summary: The G572S mutation leads to trafficking defects and reduced current density, which can be partially rescued by KCNE2.

variants.segregation_data: The G572S variant segregates with long QT syndrome in the studied population.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on functional assays and segregation data
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the role of KCNE2 in modulating the effects of the G572S mutation.
key_quotes: G572S induces trafficking defects of hERG channel protein from Golgi to the plasma membrane.
The increase of current was largest at KCNH2:KCNE2 of 1:3.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the variant was clearly defined in the text.
